Name: platelet-type bleeding disorder 16
Definition: An inherited blood coagulation disease characterized by autosomal dominant inheritance with macrothrombocytopenia
Synonym: autosomal dominant thrombasthenia of Glanzmann and Naegeli

Name: platelet-type bleeding disorder 8
Definition: An inherited blood coagulation disease characterized by mild to moderate mucocutaneous bleeding and absence of adenosine phosphate induced platelet aggregation that has_material_basis_in homozygous or compound heterozygous mutation in the P2RY12 gene on chromosome 3q.

Name: gray platelet syndrome
Definition: An inherited blood coagulation disease characterized by selective deficiency in the number and contents of platelet alpha-granules

Name: platelet-type bleeding disorder 9
Definition: An inherited blood coagulation disease characterized by autosomal dominant inheritance of mild thrombocytopenia

Name: platelet-type bleeding disorder 10
Definition: An inherited blood coagulation disease characterized by autosomal recessive inheritance of variable bleeding tendency

Name: platelet-type bleeding disorder 14
Definition: An inherited blood coagulation disease characterized by autosomal dominant inheritance of defective platelet aggegation

Name: platelet-type bleeding disorder 19
Definition: An inherited blood coagulation disease characterized by autosomal recessive inheritance of epistaxis

Name: platelet-type bleeding disorder 17
Definition: An inherited blood coagulation disease characterized by autosomal dominant inheritance of increased bleeding tendency

Name: Quebec platelet disorder
Definition: An inherited blood coagulation disease characterized by autosomal dominant inheritance of delayed onset bleeding after challenge

Name: platelet-type bleeding disorder 18
Definition: An inherited blood coagulation disease characterized by autosomal recessive inheritance of mucocutaneous bleeding
Synonym: bleeding disorder due to CalDAG-GEFI deficiency

Name: Scott syndrome
Definition: An inherited blood coagulation disease characterized by autosomal recessive inheritance of hemorrhagic episodes due to impaired platelet coagulant activity that has material_basis_in homozygous mutation in the TMEM16F gene on chromosome 12q12.

Name: platelet-type bleeding disorder 15
Definition: An inherited blood coagulation disease characterized by autosomal dominant inheritance of macrothrombocytopenia with little or no bleeding tendency and normal in vitro platelet function that has_material_basis_in heterozygous mutation in the ACTN1 gene on chromosome 14q.

Name: platelet-type bleeding disorder 20
Definition: An inherited blood coagulation disease characterized by autosomal dominant inheritance of increased bleeding tendency

Name: platelet-type bleeding disorder 3
Definition: A inherited blood coagulation disease characterized by enhanced binding of von Willebrand factor by the platelet glycoprotein Ib receptor complex that has_material_basis_in mutation in the GP1BA gene on chromosome 17p13.2.

Name: platelet-type bleeding disorder 11
Definition: An inherited blood coagulation disease characterized by autosomal recessive inheritance of mild to moderate bleeding and defective platelet activation and aggregation in response to collagen that has_material_basis_in compound heterozygous mutation in the GP6 gene on chromosome 19q13.

Name: platelet-type bleeding disorder 12
Definition: An inherited blood coagulation disease characterized by autosomal dominant inheritance of mildly increased bleeding

Name: hemophilia B
Definition: An inherited blood coagulation disease that has_material_basis_in Factor IX deficiency

Name: von Willebrand's disease
Definition: A coagulation protein disease that is a hereditary abnormality which slows the blood clotting process. It arises from a qualitative or quantitative deficiency of von Willebrand factor (vWF)

Name: factor XIII deficiency
Definition: An inherited blood coagulation disease that is characterized by easy bleeding

Name: factor VII deficiency
Definition: An inherited blood coagulation disease that is characterized by easy bleeding

Name: factor V deficiency
Definition: An inherited blood coagulation disease that is characterized by easy bleeding

Name: Bernard-Soulier syndrome
Definition: An inherited blood coagulation disease characterized by autosomal recessive inheritance of mucosal bleeding

Name: factor X deficiency
Definition: An otitis externa involving infection of the tissue surrounding the cartilage of the earlobe (pinna)

Name: congenital afibrinogenemia
Definition: An autosomal recessive disease that is characterized by bleeding symptoms due to low levels of circulating prothrombin

Name: antithrombin III deficiency
Definition: An inherited blood coagulation disease characterized by the tendency to form clots in the veins.
Synonym: hereditary thrombophilia due to congenital antithrombin deficiency

Name: protein C deficiency
Definition: An inherited blood coagulation disease characterized by the tendency to form clots in the veins.
Synonym: hereditary thrombophilia due to congenital antithrombin deficiency

Name: obsolete Fusobacterium infectious disease
Definition: An inherited blood coagulation disease characterized by the tendency to form clots in the veins.
Synonym: hereditary thrombophilia due to congenital antithrombin deficiency
